intro: Lastrea monosticha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lastrea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in spring. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soil with minimal water. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
